title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 18 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: teacher injured in schoolground playground by airgun pellet .
negotiations continue to lead cornwall council .
major campaign to reduce the number of accidents and deaths on farms launched .
first day of the devon county show 2017 .

documents.title: our live coverage across devon and cornwall
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on friday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later , which will have more on day one of the devon county show , and we 'll be covering the show again tomorrow .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: forget a gingerbread house , how about shaun the sheep 's potato house ?
text: we 've all heard of a gingerbread house , but how about a potato house ?
this fantastic effort from lifton farm shop comes complete with cauliflower sheep and an onion-paved footpath .
it 's based on children 's tv favourite shaun the sheep , with shaun himself taking centre stage in one of our here .
it 's scooped the large gold medal for trade exhibitors .
i think we can say that 's not baaaaaadd .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest weather : isolated showers overnight , and a mixed friday
text: some clear spells are likely overnight , along with isolated showers .
it will be rather chilly too .
minimum temperature : 8c ( 43f ) .
friday will see a mixture of sunny spells and showers , some of which could turn heavy and possibly thundery .
the north coast will tend to see the fewest number of showers .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: exeter city : matt oakley to retire at end of season
text: exeter city 's former southampton midfielder matt oakley has announced he will retire at the end of the season .
the 39-year-old has made 694 career appearances , reaching the 2003 fa cup final with the saints and winning promotion with derby and leicester .
he has been at the devon side since an initial loan spell in 2011 , playing 172 times without scoring a goal .
`` he 's been a great servant to exeter in the five-and-a-half years he 's been at the club , '' said manager paul tisdale .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weatherman david braine faces the elements at the devon county show
text: we 'll have the latest forecast before 18:00 .
weather david taking on the elements live @ twitterid
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: chiefs tackle cheese congratulations cake
text: a cheese cake has been made for exeter chiefs to wish them good luck for their premiership semi-final match on saturday .
it comes completed with a chiefs ' headdress on the top .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: the cutest guests at devon county show ?
text: i was hanging out with these little guys at the devon cavy club tent at devon county show .
i 'm learning already - a male guinea pig is called a boar and a female is a sow .
they can live for four to six years .
they 're sociable animals so unless you 're going to spend a lot of time handling your pet you should keep two to keep each other company .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: high flyers at devon county show
text: in the pigeon tent , the birds looked relaxed after a day of judging .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: lace making at the devon county show
text: judy and sylvia have the amazingly intricate job of making lace .
i had a quick lesson and completed one row on this snake bookmark - and my brain started hurting very quickly !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: lib dems and independents in cornwall having 'positive discussions '
text: the liberal democrat group in cornwall says it is had positive discussions with independents over possibly forming a new administration on cornwall council .
lib deb adam paynter said seven councillors from his party and the independent group had been discussing various scenarios .
as it stands , the conservative group has 46 out of the 122 seats on the council , with the liberal democrats as their nearest rivals with 37 seats , followed by 30 independent councillors .
negotiations around forming an administration broke down between the independents and the conservatives since the election .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: children 's summer club jointly wins prince of wales prize
text: the children 's summer club in barnstaple has jointly won this year 's prince of wales award at the devon county show .

the club , run entirely by volunteers , means that children aged from eight to 16 can take part in everything from sport and outdoor activities to carnival entries , drama productions , arts and crafts , day trips , cinema , bowling , skating and theatre trips .
the children are also encouraged to put something back into the local community , and take part in litter- forestry , creating murals and putting on entertainments for residents .
secretary of the club christine brennan said : `` it is wonderful to receive recognition for the work of the club .
the award will help raise our profile and , hopefully , attract new members and volunteers , and encourage networking with other community organisations .
`` we will use the prize-money to subsidise activities for local young people . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: election 2017 : cornwall and devon top searchers for vote registering information
text: voters have been turning to google for help in deciding who to back in the general election , and to find out how to register to vote .
data released to bbc news reveals the biggest interest in registering to vote in the uk came from cornwall .
pendeen in st ives topped the list , followed by ponsanooth in camborne and redruth .
whimple in east devon was fourth on the list .
people have until monday , 22 may to to register .
author: Daniel Wainwright
BBC Data Unit, English Regions

documents.title: cornwall rugby 'makes me tick ' , says coach
text: cornwall rugby coach graham dawe says being part of the county setup is `` an honour '' .
cornwall play hertfordshire on saturday for a place in the county championship final .
dawe has coached the black and gold to three finals , winning the last two in 2015 and 2016 .
he told bbc radio cornwall : `` i love my rugby .
i love being part of it .
it helps make me tick , i think .
i feel very privileged myself that i 'm involved in supporting the county , and long may it continue . ''
author: Ross Ellis
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon county show : the royal connection
text: as we saw earlier , sophie , countess of wessex , was at the devon county show to visit , and hers is the latest of many 's a royal presence .
the queen 's first outing after acceding to the throne was to visit the devon county show in 1952 .
she visited again in 1995 , and was patron of the show from 1952 to 2001 , when she was succeeded by the prince of wales .
hrh the prince of wales and the duchess of cornwall came to the show as their first public outing following their marriage in 2005 .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: rbs settlement has left business couple feeling 'gutted '
text: a couple say they still feel `` gutted '' after settling with royal bank of scotland for allegedly mis-selling them a financial insurance product .
mike and diane hockin , from plymouth , had been claiming £ 30m in damages after losing their property business in 2012 .
mr hockin told the bbc 's wake up to money that he had wanted to expose the bank on behalf of other small businesses , but felt he had to settle .
rbs has admitted no liability and the final amount has not been disclosed .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: video of care home resident enjoying music therapy receives more than 20k views
text: a video of a care home resident in falmouth enjoying a music therapy session has received thousands of views on social media .
joyce williams , who had dementia , died earlier this year but her family agreed to release the film to raise awareness about how music could help people with the condition .
ms williams was being cared for during the last part of her life at falmouth 's langholme care home .
before she became ill , she loved music and dancing and working with the charity that runs the home , mha .
music therapy sessions were arranged and joyce was filmed enjoying the experience , the original post receiving more than 20,000 views .
you can see the video here :
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: tory group leader says cornwall cabinet 'must reflect votes after elections '
text: the conservative group leader phil seeva has said that , despite having the most seats , the tories may still end up in opposition because of the independent group 's refusal to co-operate with their manifesto .
he added that this would not be `` what the people of cornwall voted for '' .
the party has 46 out of 122 seats after the most recent council election .
we felt we needed a split of six-four in our favour on the cabinet .
now that , i believe , reflects what people have voted for in this county . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: there are also food bests in show , not just the animals
text: it started raining at the devon county show i hate to admit .
but where better was there to take shelter than in the food tent ?
i stumbled across the award-winning cheeses and ciders , as well as stalls from dozens of local food producers .
yummy !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon county show : rare breeds on display
text: there are thousands of animals here today , entering hundreds of separate competitions .
from bees to ewes , and guinea pigs to cows , there 's plenty to see , and will be for the next couple of days too .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: all aboard !
text: some of the many school groups at the devon county show enjoyed hitching a round on the train .
all aboard !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: showjumping attracts the crowds
text: the showjumping was a popular event this afternoon .
crowds enjoyed the sunshine - perfect weather for the show before some cloud came over later
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: train hits road signs put on track at yeoford
text: a train hit road signs placed on the track at yeoford station in devon , british transport police have said .
it happened at about 06:15 on monday 15 may as the 05:50 great western railway service between exeter st david 's and barnstaple was passing through yeoford .
as the train went around a bend , the driver noticed the signs on the tracks but could n't stop , police said .
it is believed the signs were put on the tracks between 01:30 and 06:15 the same morning .
officers have launched an investigation and appealed for witnesses .
trains travel at high speeds , and objects such as road signs have the potential to cause significant damage to a train or at worst , derail them .
it is miraculous that nobody was seriously injured or killed as a result of one person 's careless and utterly stupid behaviour . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: cornwall council still 'in limbo ' without leader after elections
text: fourteen days after the local elections , cornwall council remains without an administration or leader .
the result left no party with enough councillors to take overall control .
despite taking 46 seats , the conservatives have so far failed to win the backing of the independent group , to give them a working majority .

they could form a minority administration , but talks are also under way between the second largest group - the liberal democrats - and the independents , who said they hoped to reach an agreement by close of play tomorrow .
the leader of mebyon kernow , dick cole , whose party retained four seats on the council , said some mistakes had been made during negotiations .
it certainly does n't give other people faith in what 's happening .
i think the conservatives in their negotiations have made some pretty fundamental blunders , like asking a different group to sign up to your manifesto . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: back to the animals : at the cow wash
text: ever wondered how you wash cattle ?
there 's a cow version of a power shower behind the cattle arena here at devon county show .
they all looked nice and relaxed during their pamper session !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: it 's not just animals at the show , there are classic vehicles too
text: devon county show is n't just farm animals , there 's displays of classic cars , farm vehicles and steam-powered exhibits .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: shire horses in main arena
text: shore horses are now taking to the stage in the main arena .
the weather might look a bit gloomy but these beautiful horses are brightening up the day !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: sick of all these puns ? alpaca my bags
text: the alpacas are being judged over on road 9 at the devon county show .
one has even decided to sit down while the judge mulled over his decision .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon county show : live forging competition - this contest heats up
text: the live forging competition has been under way , where competitors have 30 minutes to make a sellable item to a specified design .
good luck , guys !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon county show : countess of wessex visits the bbc south west tent
text: sophie , countess of wessex , has visited the bbc south west tent at the devon county show .
she spoke to presenter justin leigh and you can see more of her visit on spotlight tonight on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: prince of wales award jointly won by crediton community bookshop
text: the crediton community bookshop has jointly won this year 's prince of wales award at the devon county show
the shop 's aim is to promote literacy and literature and to foster a love of reading among children .
judges said they were particularly impressed by the fact that the bookshop 's outreach programme took in many very small schools in rural areas , as well as large secondary schools .

manager dee lalljee said they were honoured to be joint winners : `` we are very proud of this recognition for our schools outreach programme , and the talented and passionate team of volunteers who make this happen . ''
both the bookshop and fellow joint winner the children 's summer club in barnstaple will receive £ 500 and a framed certificate .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: police treating airgun incident at school 'seriously '
text: police say they are treating a teacher being struck with an airgun pellet at a school in exeter as a serious incident .

police received the report on tuesday afternoon that the female staff member was hit `` by the pellet from an air rifle '' on a playground in the rear yard of st wilfrid 's school on st david 's hill .
the teacher suffered minor injuries and none of the children present were reported to have been harmed .
devon and cornwall police said they currently had no suspects .
the force added that officers would be continuing house-to-house enquiries and carrying out additional visible police patrols in the area to reassure the local community .
police are treating this incident seriously , although we have limited lines of enquiry .
the location is overlooked by around 30 bedsits or flats .
however , it is not clear if it came from those locations . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: the history of devon county show
text: the history of devon county show
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: election 2017 : people turn to google for help ahead of election
text: voters have been turning to google for help in deciding who to back in the general election .
data released to bbc news reveals the areas of the uk where `` who should i vote for '' was the most popular request .
there has also been a rise in searches for `` register to vote '' ahead of monday 's deadline , with areas in devon and cornwall using the search engine the most for such information .
people have until monday , 22 may to register to vote .
author: Daniel Wainwright
BBC Data Unit, English Regions

documents.title: to hull and back : road blocked by boat
text: exeter , sandygate lane for m5 south onslip j30 boat in the road hg
should have claimed salvage rights lol

documents.title: devon county show : will it bee a sting from the judges ?
text: in the bee and honey exhibit , susan is checking honey for granulation while working out what to mark the exhibits .
they include honey , beeswax candles and mead .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: sheep shearing a 'fascinating skill '
text: today 's sheep shearing competitions have been under way .
each competitor has three sheep to shear by hand .
it 's a `` fascinating , dexterous and demanding skill '' , according to the commentator here .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: spotlight live at devon county show
text: spotlight has been live from devon county show .
presenter victoria graham was reporting from the bbc marquee , overlooking the showjumping ground .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: school playground stays out of bounds after airgun pellet hits teacher
text: a school playground where a teacher was struck by an airgun pellet will stay out of bounds to children at least until monday says the headteacher .
the female teacher was hit in the chest by the pellet in the playground of st wilfrid 's school in exeter on tuesday .
ross bovingdon , headteacher designate , said : `` the pellet hit the backboard and rebounded onto the teacher .
`` the teacher reacted straight away and ordered the children inside and alerted the police straight away .
`` our main priority was making everyone safe . ''
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: the bear that boldly went where no bear-dy had gone before
text: a mascot sent up to the edge of space before being washed out to sea has been found , in bude .

the mascot , from cornwall 's pool academy , buzz the bear , was strapped onto a helium weather balloon and sent 20 miles up into space last friday to capture images of the school and its surroundings .
the space mission , called project infinity , was a success despite the `` cloudy and windy weather conditions '' said the school .
buzz was placed in a box with a camera , which took photographs every minute , and tracked by a gps , so he could be up from wherever he landed .
but buzz 's future was far from certain as `` gusts at lower altitudes took him out to sea off boscastle '' , phil jones from the school said .
luckily , after landing in the ocean , buzz was washed up , with his equipment intact on the beach at bude .
mr jones said he was found `` by a lady with her metal detector '' .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon county show 'could see record turnout of farmers due to brexit '
text: rural commentator anthony gibson predicts farmers will turnout in exceptionally high numbers at the devon county show .
mr gibson said uncertain times triggered by brexit would attract the farming community .

i think we could see a record turnout of farmers in modern times - partly because of all of that , partly because everyone 's either up together or ahead of the game with their farm work - thanks to the wonderfully dry april - and partly because there 'll be more than ever for farmers to see , talk about and buy .
there 'll be plenty of discussion at the show , which is the first major show since article 50 was triggered . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter city gear up for 'absolute thriller ' play-off
text: it looks to be an interesting night for exeter city fans with the semi-final play-off second leg against carlisle .
the first leg ended 3-3 , so tonight 's match at st james park will be a tense one .
about 9,000 home fans will be there , led by chairman julian tagg .
it 's very exciting times .
the adrenaline is going .
it 's important for everybody .
if it was anything like the game on sunday night , it 's going to be an absolute thriller .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: head teacher statement following airgun shooting at school
text: the head teacher of a school in exeter has released a statement after a teacher was hit by an airgun pellet in the playground on tuesday .
the female staff member at st wilfrid 's was hit in the chest by the pellet fired from outside the grounds .
she was given medical attention , but not seriously injured .
no children were hurt , the school said .

during a key stage two pe lesson - so , seven to nine-year-olds - they were doing a striking and fielding lesson , the air rifle pellet hit the back board , rebounded into the teacher and the teacher reacted straight away and got all the children inside , into the building safe .
we alerted the police straight away .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: new spotlight presenters take over devon county show
text: chris and three-year-old olivia have been giving spotlight presenters victoria and justin a run for their money at the devon county show today .
pop into our marquee where you can sit in the spotlight chairs and take a look around !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon county show : medal-winning exhibit goes like fleece lightning !
text: the potato house - a gold medal-winning exhibit in the crafts and garden feature at devon county show - has plenty going on , some of it based on tv favourite shaun the sheep , it appears .
can you see mutton dressed as lamb , fleece lightning and the three little pigs ?
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: bees create a buzz while exploring the devon county show
text: these bees have free reign of the showground , but will always return to their temporary home here .
their working area is within three miles of the hive .
their keepers will wait until after dark to move them , to make sure they have all returned back , before being taken home to tavistock .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: 33,000 poppies displayed at devon county show
text: a total of 33,000 poppies are being displayed at the devon county show to remember local men and women who lost their lives in world war one .
six months ago the show appealed to local people to make a poppy and received almost three times the target total .
the commemoration was the idea of deborah custance baker , the chief steward of the crafts and gardens pavilion , who took inspiration from the 2016 chelsea flower show .
she said : `` i have been completely overwhelmed by the support for this project - the youngest to create a poppy is four years old , the oldest is 94-years-young .
`` all the poppies are different - different wool , different colours , different interpretations , but then so were the men and women lost . ''
the display will contain the same number of poppies as the lives lost from not just devon ( 11,500 ) , but also cornwall ( 6,000 ) , somerset ( 9,000 ) and dorset ( 4,500 ) .
the poppies are on display in the crafts and gardens feature , and displayed in exeter cathedral on remembrance weekend .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon county show : spotlight 's cameras roll
text: we 're not quite sure what 's going directly behind victoria graham , but we 're hopeful no , confident it 's a necessary technical thing .
spotlight on the devon county show - the day is well underway .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: royal visitor at the devon county show
text: there is a royal visitor at the devon county show today .
sophie , countess of wessex , is here to visit the exhibits and meet some of the animals .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: emergency services take part in the fun at devon county show
text: family friendly fun at # devoncountyshow @ twitterid
meet the police at # devoncountyshow stand 451 road 12 - fingerprinting , drones , police dogs and more !
@ twitterid # devonsbigdayout
and the positive action team !
the sun is shining on our stand at the @ twitterid come and say hello , we 're on stand 454 road 12 .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: south west sees 'more fatalities on farms than any other region in gb '
text: latest figures from the health and safety executive indicate there are more fatalities on farms in the south west than any other region in england - six out of 29 fatalities in great britain in the year 2015/16 .
a campaign to reduce the number of accidents and deaths on farms is being launched today at the devon county show .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: countryside 'should be brexit priority ' - campaigners
text: investing in the countryside should be a national priority after brexit as existing european union subsidies end , campaigners have urged .

long-term contracts for farmers to provide public services - such as wildlife habitat , investment in the wider agricultural sector to make it more resilient and funding for projects such as improving broadband coverage - are all needed , they argue .

the country land and business association ( cla ) is launching a countryside matters campaign at the devon county show to urge the public to show they care about the countryside and want to see investment in it .
the cla also wants politicians standing in the general election to show their support for investing in the countryside .
there is risk once the uk leaves the eu .
it is vital for the government to treat farming , the rural economy and our landscapes as a public investment priority .
money can be spent in new ways to deliver better outcomes for the economy and environment . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon county show : fancy some time travelling ?
text: you can travel back in time at the devon county show today - by stepping on the virtual mayflower at the barbican in 1620 .

the bbc devon tent has a host of other virtual reality experiences - with the chance to do a space walk , explore the hms a7 submarine , which sank in 1914 ; and explore the yelverton-to-princetown railway .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: torridge council experiences telephone service disruption
text: torridge council is reporting `` ongoing faults '' with its telephone services , affecting incoming and outgoing calls that may take days to repair .
a spokesperson said three engineering companies were working on the issue and email services were unaffected .
they added : `` we apologise for the inconvenience this will inevitably cause , but the problems are outside of the council 's control . ''
people have been asked only to attempt to contact the council by telephone if their need was `` urgent and can not wait '' .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: the devon county show displays start : the cattle arena
text: displays and competitions have started at the devon county show .
here is some of the early activity at the cattle arena .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: parents 'shocked ' after playground injury by airgun shooting
text: parents have said they are `` shocked '' after a teacher was hit by an airgun pellet in front of children in the playground of a school in devon .
police have launched an investigation after the pellet was found in the playground of st wilfrid 's school , exeter .
the school said parents had since been informed about the shooting .
one told the bbc they were `` very shocked about what 's happened '' .
they added : `` a child could easily have been blinded . ''
a senior teacher at the school said he could not think of any reason for the shooting and that `` nothing like this has happened here before '' .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: teacher injured in school playground by airgun
text: a teacher has been hit by an airgun pellet in front of young children in a private school 's playground in devon .
it happened at st wilfrid 's school in exeter .
the female teacher was hit in the chest by a pellet fired from outside the grounds but was not seriously injured , the school said .
it happened in the playground during a pe lesson on tuesday at about 14:00 .
the pellet struck a wall and ricocheted before hitting her , the school told the bbc .
about eight children aged between seven and nine were in the playground at the time .
all were taken to safety inside the school and none were hurt .
the playground has been placed out of bounds , and children are being kept away from the area .
however , lessons and exams are continuing as normal .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: at the devon county show
text: i 'm reporting from devon county show today .
the queen is entering two horses into classes in the packed equine programme , there will be a display of 33,000 handmade poppies , and bbc spotlight will be broadcast live from the show later .
if you see us , come and say hello !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: siblings david hichens and camilla contrino attack brother 's ex maria long after he torched her home
text: two siblings attacked their brother 's former partner of 26 years in broad daylight a week after he was sent to jail for torching her home .
author: Cornwall Live

sunny spells will continue throughout the day , but scattered showers will develop too , some of which could be heavy , particularly during the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 16c ( 61f ) .

documents.title: joint winners of devon county show 's prince of wales award
text: two community projects have been declared joint winners of this year 's prince of wales award , given by the devon county agricultural association , to celebrate community sustainability in devon .

they are the children 's summer club , a street-based youth club in barnstaple , and the crediton community bookshop , which aims to promote literature and literacy for the benefit of people in mid-devon .
the chairman of the judges , lady arran , said it had proved impossible to separate the two projects , and it had been decided that this year 's award should be shared .
she said : `` they are so very different , but what they have in common is , first of all , a shared determination to improve the quality of life for people in their respective areas .
`` secondly , they have a strong focus on young people .
thirdly , the fact that they are both making a real difference for the better .
`` they both epitomize what the prince of wales award is all about . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: car 'targeted ' in exmouth suffers £ 4k of damage
text: about £ 4,000 worth of damage has been caused to a car in exmouth after vandals dented the roof , police say .
officers said the black vw jetta was `` targeted '' by three men at about 22:55 on saturday 29 april in cleveland place .
after the incident , the men walked through the alleyway next to garner 's home hardware and on to the strand , they added .
the main offender was described as white , aged 25 to 30 , between 5ft 9ins and 6ft tall , with a stocky build , and wearing jeans and a white shirt .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Rob England

documents.title: devon county show 2017 : day one , and heavy traffic expected
text: it 's the opening day of the devon county show today and tens of thousands of people are heading towards westpoint for the three-day event .
the start of the show always brings huge numbers of visitors to the site and this year 's event will likely be no exception .
drivers are being warned to expect delays if they 're heading towards the westpoint showground , near exeter .
we 'll bring you the latest travel information as the day goes on .
# devoncountyshow monitoring traffic approaching westpoint , adjusting flows using cctv & utc throughout the morning to help commuters hg
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: local live across devon and cornwall
text: good morning from bbc local live this thursday morning .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
reporter sian davies will also be bringing you live updates from the first day of this year 's devon county show .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online
